The claim is based on a headline from th: which stated that "Trump vows to end winter heating assistance for elderly and disabled." This is the initial source of the claim.
The claim was flagged by Facebook users: prompting further investigation into its authenticity. This indicates that there were doubts raised about the accuracy of the claim.
The expert: s verdict mentions that while Trump proposed eliminating a heating assistance program several months ago, the federal government has continued to fund it. This implies that the claim may not accurately represent the current situation.
A bipartisan group of senators: including Susan Collins and Jack Reed, wrote a letter urging the federal government to release funds for the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) as quickly as possible. This demonstrates that there was opposition to Trump's proposed cuts to the program, further questioning the validity of the claim.
